p: The aerial parts (flowers, leaves and stems) of TC were collected in North Sardinia (40°82′02″ N; 8°63′10″ E) from wild plants growing on marl soil over limestone. Harvesting took place in mid-June when the plants were fully flowering, in the so-called “balsamic time”, which is the period of the plant growth cycle in which essential oil and/or specific metabolite production reaches its maximum.
